metadata.title: CVE-2016-5136 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in extensions/renderer/user_script_injector.ccin the Extensions subsystem in Google Chrome before 52.0.2743.82 allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecifiedother impact via vectors related to script deletion.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5136` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-browser-l10n - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-chromedriver - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250').
